p: Modest increases in the state average probability and severity of a water balance deficit in late summer are observed, with the smallest increases projected for B1 and the greatest for A2 scenario ( Fig 2). At the district level the pattern is similar, except under B1 where districts on the eastern half of the state appear to be transitioning to the smaller deficit risk projected by end of the century ( S1 File). Among all the scenarios the West, West Southwest, and Southwest districts consistently show increased odds of deficit risk (approximately 4:3) compared to the baseline.
